ygData.subject: RE: Stupid Question
ygData.msgSnippet: Curious.  I remember when first playing a dark elf after playing a wood elf for a long time that the only difference I saw was that pixies now glowed kinds
ygData.messageBody:
Curious. I remember when first playing a dark elf after playing a wood elf
for a long time that the only difference I saw was that pixies now glowed
kinds blue at night as opposed to the pink I saw before.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Kyle Sibbald [mailto:ksibbald@...]
Sent: Tuesday, December 07, 1999 4:46 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Stupid Question


From: "Kyle Sibbald" <ksibbald@...>

As the traditional definition of the two terms yes. In game it seems
that
infravision only tends to increase contrast. I remember when I was young in
East Commonlands that at night the skeletons were easy to see since they
were light in color but the bears were almost impossible to spot.

-----Original Message-----
From: Josh Moore [mailto:josh@...]
Sent: Tuesday, December 07, 1999 5:27 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Stupid Question


From: "Josh Moore" <josh@...>

Infra vision outlines Warm bodies and objects in a light red haze.
Ultravision lets you see better in the dark makes everythign bright, with a
blue tinge. much better than infra

-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel P. Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
Sent: Tuesday, December 07, 1999 6:20 PM
To: EQ Bards
Subject: [eqbards] Stupid Question


I should know this - and could probably look it up if I'm not lazy..
But what's the difference between Ultravision and Infravision..

Slyde
